document_data.name: Thump
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|21}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Thump''''' was a haunting [[cantrip]] that acolyte [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It created an auditory illusion of a heavy object falling a short distance.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip was a variation of ''[[groan]]'' that simulated the sound of a weighty object falling a distance of about {{SI|1|ft|c|long=yes}}. The range of this spell was {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}} from the casterThe original description of this spell in [[Dragon magazine 60|''Dragon'' #60]] used the 1{{st}}-edition nomenclature 1", meaning {{SI|10|ft}} indoors and {{SI|10|yd}} outdoors. This was simplified to the shorter range in ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]''. and the noise could appear to come from behind, under, or inside other things. All creatures in close proximity that could be expected to hear the sound had a chance to resist the spell. If successful, they not aware of the illusion.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster imagined the desired sound in their head, then swallowed loudly and pointed at the target location.
